alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 3:21AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from a glacier-dammed lake outburst across the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taku River. - The rate of rise on the Taku River has slowed down, and we will continue to monitor the river through the early morning. - For Taku River near Juneau: At 2:00am the stage was 43.23 feet. Flood Stage is 43.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 44.4 feet is expected around 4:00am Friday. Impacts: At 43.3 feet: The water level will be at the top of the hill in front of the house near the gauge. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along Taku River stay alert and be prepared to take action. - The cold water temperatures can increase the threat of hypothermia and lower the time required to cause hypothermia.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
